name: Cadillac Mountain

trails_config.name: Cadillac North Ridge Trail
trails_config.description: The highest point on the North Atlantic seaboard. Famous for being the first place in the U.S. to see the sunrise. Offers sweeping views of Bar Harbor and Frenchman Bay.
trails_config.parking_info: North Ridge Trailhead, Park Loop Rd, Bar Harbor, ME

trails_config.name: Cadillac South Ridge Trail
trails_config.description: A longer, more gradual ascent from Blackwoods Campground. Passes 'The Featherbed', a small glacial pond, before reaching the granite summit.
trails_config.parking_info: Route 3 near Blackwoods Campground, Bar Harbor, ME

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in Maine. Standing at 1530 feet, Cadillac Mountain offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 1530 feet, Cadillac Mountain is a standout peak in Maine. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Cadillac North Ridge Trail**, a **4.4 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Champlain Mountain (Precipice)**, which is just 1.5 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
